basics.name: Tim Lin
basics.label: AI Researcher
basics.summary: An AI researcher and independent developer with expertise in deep learning, bioprocess modeling, and antibody sequence generation. Passionate about advancing science through the development of cutting-edge AI solutions and committed to building platforms - DeepBioLab to solve and share biological and technical problems.

Proposed innovative solutions to business challenges using AI and cutting-edge technologies
Facilitated cross-department collaborations to accelerate the drug discovery and development process

Managed data analysis tasks and the data team

publications.name: AbDPP: Target-oriented antibody design with pretraining and prior biological structure knowledge
publications.summary: This study presents AbDPP, a novel approach for target-oriented antibody design that integrates pretraining and prior biological structure knowledge. The methodology significantly enhances antibody design accuracy, leveraging deep learning models to incorporate structural and biological insights. The approach has promising applications in the field of antibody engineering and therapeutic development.

projects.name: Molecular Generation Model based on Transformer
projects.summary: Constructed a Transformer model for chemical reaction retro-synthesis data sets, predicting possible reactants for a given product. This project explored the applicability of large-scale NLP models to molecular synthesis tasks.
highlights: Optimized TensorFlow code for faster convergence
Explored new business routes for molecular synthesis tasks

projects.name: Bayesian Optimization-based Medium Component Search
projects.summary: Aimed to optimize cell culture efficiency and quality by using Bayesian optimization to search for the best medium component combination. The project significantly reduced search time and costs compared to traditional methods.
highlights: Surpassed commercial culture media in only three iterations
Applied Bayesian optimization to improve cell growth and metabolism

projects.name: Hybrid Model for Bioprocess Using Physics-Informed Neural Networks
projects.summary: Developed hybrid models using Physics-Informed Neural Networks (PINN) to estimate time-varying kinetic parameters in bioprocesses. Combined kinetic structures with neural networks to improve temporal simulation tasks.
highlights: Achieved high accuracy in parameter identification and trajectory simulation
Improved bioprocess modeling accuracy with a mean absolute error of 1%
